channel.title: Need Major programming help
channel.description:
Ok, what I am trying to do is, when people go on my client, it checks a certain file online ( got that code ), if the thing in the text file is 0, a boolean is false, if its 1, a boolean is true, etc. Now, what it does next, so if the boolean is false, goes on. But if the boolean is true. It download the new jpg off the webserver and replaces the current one in the user's client folder... But I also need this to be done by the time the client requests the jpg :S
Any help would be greatly appreciated. :o

item.title: Need Major programming help
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Find the method that calls PixelGrabber (which draws the picture), and put a check right before that. I reccomend using XML like this:

java.util.Properties properties = new java.util.Properties(); boolean download = Boolean.valueOf(properties.getProperty("download")); if(download) { //download stuff here } //rest of PixelGrabber method

And your XML file will look like this:

[code]<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

true [/code]

–

By the way, Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(byte abyte0[], Component component) is 317’s method to draw the title page.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Major programming help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

do it in the beginning before you even start the client, that way you know it will be done downloading in time, to download the file you must simply write the code to download files from java, or leech the code off someone else if I get to my computer with the moparscape 3.0 source on it I will show you the file downloading code

Read full topic
